result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has 3 cases pending.  The State has only 1 file in court.  Due to the lateness of the hour, Court ordered case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is ready to change her plea but the State only has 1 of the 3 files.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance is waived for today's date. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM021660  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/24/2015
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - Missed office contact/missed drug test and portable breathalyzer.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with WALMART, 6701 S 27TH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez not in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart, 6701 S. 27th St.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Zulma Dely Mercado-Rodriguez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
